review_title: Too much for too little pay
years_at_company: Too much for too little pay
pros: It's a job for the moment....do not get complacent.
cons: Employee Appreciation week is great.

pros: Commission package is generous if you're able to keep up. Aflac is a great company, they genuinely care about their customers, and want to help people.
cons: As an insurance producer you are responsible for finding all of your own business entirely. It's B2B soliciting and cold calling - 150 cold calls per appointment, 40 doors walked through per appointment are the statistics. If you can get one appointment per day then you'll do great, but you MUST have a drive to succeed and a passion for sales. If you can't manage yourself, and can't make one appointment per day then you will fail, and it is 100% commission as a 1099 employee. No benefits. Either you can enjoy B2B sales and soliciting or you can't, there is no in between with the job. If you can't, then you won't make money. If you're on the fence and need a guaranteed paycheck then find a W-2 position elsewhere. I have it a shot because I liked the idea, I liked the idea of being my own boss. I just couldn't bring myself to ever cold call, I hated it once I started trying it, and door to door was better but I just didn't have the drive for it. Just know what you're getting in to. You can absolutely succeed if you have the drive and the passion, but it's a hard road your first two years.
advice_to_mgmt: Feedback I've had from a business owner who used to have aflac: it was impossible to get a hold of the rep and there was no support, it made it seem like all we cared about was the initial money. I think you'd do much better off having dedicated W-2 account servicers, who specialize in account retention. I know a lot of that goes to the more seasoned sales producers, but it's very hard to get a new producer started and keep them onboard long enough to get to that point, meanwhile accounts fall off the books.

pros: We have great benefits, 401K is important to me as well as PTO

pros:
You choose your own hours and can make a nice career out of Aflac.

The commission structure is good if you plan on staying with Aflac for the long term.

The training is fantastic. They really can make a good salesperson out of anybody with the heart to do it.

Coworkers are super fun people. Every aflac event is a blast
cons:
You WILL be broke for the first year regardless how hard you work.

No customer has ever been glad to see me in the 6 months i've been doing it. They're usually nice and all, but the fact that everybody just wants you up leave when they realize what you're up to is disheartening.

pros: Teamwork. Employee appreciation, stock and 401k
cons: Corporate. Sales driven. Quota. Unfair corporate promotions
